result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Thomas Ian McKay

records.addlTxt:
Clerk Marisa. 
Case Called: 8:33 am 
INCLUDES 15CF474 AND 15CM1116. 
State appears by ADA Chris Plaunt and Raymond Pelrine; Def appears in person, in custody with Atty Keith Ellison. 
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed. VRCW. 

State moves to: 
In 15CF474: Ct. 1 (Burglary - Armed with Dangerous Weapon)>>AMEND to Theft from Person pursuant to 943.20(1)(a)(3)(e). 
                    : Ct. 2 (Armed Robbery with Threat of Force)>>AMEND Burglary pursuant to 943.10(1m). 
In 15CM1116: Ct. 1 (Possess Drug Paraphernalia)>>D&RI. 
COURT grants above. 

PLEA: In 15CF474: Amended Ct. 1 (Theft from Person)>>NO CONTEST. 
                               : Amended Ct. 2 (Burglary)>>NO CONTEST. 

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis, & def guilty. 

COURT ORDERS: PSI be completed within 6 weeks of today's date. 
COURT directs parties to see JA to set sentencing hearing. 
State requests def be held without bail pending sentencing. 
Argument. 
COURT makes findings. 
COURT revokes bond - def to be held pending sentencing. 
Sentencing set for 8/7/2018 at 2:00 pm in Br. 3. 
Adj: 8:51 am

Clerk Marisa. 
Case Called: 2:37 pm 
INCLUDES 15CF747 AND 15CM1116. 
State appears by ADA Chris Plaunt; Deft appears in person, in custody with Atty Keith Ellison. 
State notes stipulation of the parties re: authenticity of surveillance videos. 
State notes deft has stipulated that there are no Miranda Goodchild issues. 
COURT questions deft and Atty Ellison re: Miranda Goodchild. 
Deft and Atty Ellison waive any Miranda Goodchild issues. 

STATE'S MOTION IN LIMINE. 
#1 - Granted. 
#2 - To be addressed morning of trial. 
#3 - Granted. 
#4 - Granted. 
#5 - Granted. 
#6 - Granted 
Atty Ellison requests deft be found indigent for purposes of subpoenaing witnesses. 
Argument. 
COURT defers ruling re: payment of subpoenas. 
#7 - Granted. 
#8 - Granted. 
#9 - To be ruled on when objection raised. 
#10 - Granted. 
#11 - Granted. 
#12 - Granted. 
#13 - To be ruled on later. 
#14 - Granted as stated. 
#15 - Granted. 
#16 - Waiver accepted. 
#17 - Not relevant. 
#18 - Argument. COURT gives ruling. 

DEFT'S MOTION IN LIMINE. 
#1 - Granted. 
#2 - Argument. COURT gives ruling. 
#3 - Withdrawn. 
#4 - State and defense have reached an agreement. 
#5 - To be addressed morning of trial. 

COURT directs counsel to be present at 8:30 am the day of trial. 
COURT advises counsel re: jury trial practices. 
COURT notes intent to have 2 alternate jurors - 24 to be seated and each side to have 5 strikes. 
COURT directs counsel to develop statement of the case if they are able to do so. 
COURT directs, if possible, exhibits be marked ahead of time. 
COURT will furnish preliminary set of jury instructions/verdict form the morning of trial. 
Atty Ellison notes possibility of theft as lesser included. 
COURT notes request of Atty Ellison to have deft housed in Marathon County. 
Jail Court Officer indicates deft to be transferred tomorrow, but will notify supervisors of need to have deft brought back to Marathon County Jail by Friday of this week. 
State raises concerns with witnesses on deft's witness list. 
Argument. 
COURT directs parties to try this case and raise objections as needed. 
Adj: 3:45 pm
Correspondence to Judge Jacobson re subpoenas
Motion hearing on May 14, 2018 at 02:30 pm.

Clerk Marisa. 
Case Called: 8:59 am 
INCLUDES 15CF474 AND 15CM1116. 
State appears by ADA Chris Plaunt; Deft appears in person, in custody with Atty Keith Ellison. 
Date and time set for oral ruling on deft's motion to enforce plea agreement. 
COURT notes file review and questions parties re: plea agreement. 
COURT makes findings. 
COURT gives rulings - denies motion. 
Adj: 9:12 am
Oral ruling on January 4, 2018 at 09:00 am.
